subject: English
stem: In recommending Bao Phi’s collection Sông I Sing, a librarian noted that pieces by the spoken-word poet don’t lose their ______ nature when printed: the language has the same pleasant musical quality on the page as it does when performed by Phi.
solution_rationale: 'Pleasant musical quality' matches 'melodic'; others mismatch tone or meaning.

subject: English
stem: The coach praised the player’s ______ performance, noting both precision and artistic expression on the field.
solution_rationale: 'Precision and artistic expression' imply emotional depth → 'poignant'.

subject: English
stem: The director's early films are admired for their ______ pacing, moving the story forward without unnecessary scenes.
solution_rationale: 'Measured' means controlled and even; opposite of 'erratic'.

subject: English
stem: Although the essay's tone is stern, the author's underlying attitude is surprisingly ______.

subject: English
stem: The critic argued that the novel's imagery is more ______ than realistic—anchored in metaphor and dream rather than concrete detail.

subject: English
stem: In context, the phrase 'an austere charm' most likely means:

subject: English
stem: The politician’s statement had a ______ tone—measured and deliberately restrained.

subject: English
stem: When the reviewer calls the performance 'reserved', she means that it is:

subject: English
stem: The memoir’s prose is spare but ______ — each sentence is economical yet vivid.

subject: English
stem: The phrase 'the painting’s luminous quality' most nearly means:
optionA: an attribute of brightness or glow

subject: English
stem: Researchers hypothesized that a flexible fin improves fish maneuverability. Which experimental result would most strongly support this claim?
optionA: Model with flexible fin had more drag at high speed.
optionB: Model with flexible fin turned more quickly in sharp turns.
optionC: Model with flexible fin displaced less water.
optionD: Model with flexible fin used more battery power.
solution_rationale: Direct support: faster turns = better maneuverability.

subject: English
stem: A study claims that a protein increases cell resilience under heat stress. Which finding best supports this claim?
optionA: Cells with the protein maintained higher viability after heat exposure.
optionB: Cells with the protein consumed more glucose.
optionC: Cells with the protein showed altered shape.
optionD: Cells with the protein expressed an unrelated enzyme.

subject: English
stem: A literary argument claims that the protagonist’s generosity is performative rather than sincere. Which quotation best supports this claim?
optionA: 'She gave away her coat, smiling broadly as the crowd watched.'
optionB: 'She kept her coat for years, never offering it.'
optionC: 'She spoke earnestly of charity in private.'

subject: English
stem: If an author argues that a novel celebrates urban life’s anonymity, which piece of textual evidence best supports that claim?
optionA: A passage describing crowded streets where people pass without noticing each other.
optionB: A passage describing a single character’s private diary.
optionC: A passage describing a quiet rural village.
optionD: A passage that lists the city's buildings' heights.

subject: English
stem: Which of these findings would weaken the hypothesis that a larger tail increases a bird's flight efficiency?
optionA: Birds with larger tails showed lower energy expenditure for the same speed.
optionB: Birds with larger tails had no change in average cruising speed.
optionC: Birds with larger tails required more muscle work for sharp evasive maneuvers.
optionD: Birds with larger tails traveled farther in windless tests.

subject: English
stem: A critic claims a poem's tone is elegiac (mourning). Which quotation would most strongly support that interpretation?
optionA: 'She danced under lanterns with laughter bright.'
optionB: 'He walked past the shuttered windows and wept.'

subject: English
stem: To test whether a sail improved turning agility in models, researchers measured time to complete a sharp turn. Which result best supports the sail-improves-agility hypothesis?
optionA: Sail model completed the turn in less time than the no-sail model.
optionB: Sail model had higher battery draw.
optionC: Sail model displaced more water volume overall.
optionD: Sail model had identical straight-line speed only.

subject: English
stem: Which choice is best evidence for the claim that a character is pretentious?
optionA: He walked modestly and avoided attention.
optionB: He bragged loudly about minor achievements.
optionC: He kept a low diary unseen by others.
optionD: He apologized frequently for small mistakes.

subject: English
stem: If a study's hypothesis is 'X causes increased accuracy', which experimental result would support that?
optionA: X treatment led to higher measured accuracy than control.
optionB: X treatment led to longer setup times but same accuracy.
optionC: X treatment led to no change in accuracy.
optionD: X treatment reduced participant satisfaction only.

subject: English
stem: A literary claim says the narrator is unreliable because of memory lapses. Which quotation best supports that claim?
optionA: 'I remember the afternoon clearly: or at least that's how I told it later.'

subject: English
stem: When a fire burns red or green or blue, the color of its flames ______ the chemical composition of the combustible material.

subject: English
stem: Neither the manager nor the employees ______ willing to work weekends this month.
solution_rationale: Verb agrees with nearer plural noun → 'are'.

subject: English
stem: Every one of the proposals ______ been carefully reviewed by the committee.

subject: English
stem: The pair of shoes on the shelf ______ expensive than they look.

subject: English
stem: There ______ a series of errors in the calculation that explains the discrepancy.

subject: English
stem: Not only the students but also the teacher ______ prepared to present the findings.

subject: English
stem: Hardly had the meeting started when the speakers ______ interrupted by a power outage.

subject: English
stem: Each of the solutions ______ listed on the worksheet.

subject: English
stem: The committee, along with the chair, ______ deciding on the policy tomorrow.
solution_rationale: 'Committee' is singular; 'along with' doesn’t change number.

subject: English
stem: If either the director or the producers ______ available, we will begin filming.
solution_rationale: Verb agrees with nearer plural noun 'producers' → 'are'.
